decks.notes: This UR Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Marauding Mako and Vivi Ornitier to quickly put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Fear of Missing Out and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to maintain hand advantage and board presence. With a mix of burn spells like Torch the Tower and Thundering Falls, as well as disruptive cards like Spell Pierce, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage to the opponent. The mana base is optimized for consistent early game plays and aggressive strategies.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by powerful removal spells and other support cards. By playing efficient creatures like Imodane's Recruiter and Warden of the Inner Sky, as well as utilizing cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Knight-Errant of Eos to quickly pump out tokens, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the start and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of Arabella, Abandoned Doll and Case of the Gateway Express adds versatility and additional win conditions to the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells, while also utilizing control elements to disrupt their strategy. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence with cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Floodpits Drowner, while also utilizing removal spells like Go for the Throat to deal with threats. The inclusion of cards like Tishana's Tidebinder and Phantom Interference provide additional disruption, while cards like Soulstone Sanctuary and Faebloom Trick help to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and control the battlefield to secure victory.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost creatures and removal spells to control the board while steadily building up aggressive threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of powerful creatures like Glissa Sunslayer, Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, and Archfiend of the Dross. The removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down help to clear the way for your creatures to push through damage. With a mix of creatures and removal, this deck is designed to apply constant pressure and end the game swiftly.

The deck aims to quickly disrupt and control the opponent through hand disruption, removal, and counter spells while building card advantage and board presence through creatures and card draw. It utilizes a mix of aggro and control elements to overwhelm the opponent and maintain board control. The deck focuses on tempo and efficiency to outpace the opponent and secure victory through a combination of aggression and disruption.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on opponents with efficient creatures like Mosswood Dreadknight and Sentinel of the Nameless City. It also employs removal spells like Go for the Throat and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with threats. The deck aims to control the board while continuing to apply pressure with a mix of creatures and removal spells. Additionally, it includes some disruptive elements like Tear Asunder and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck's strategy is to be fast and aggressive while maintaining control over the game.

This Mono White Control deck focuses on using a mix of removal spells and powerful creatures to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With cards like Day of Judgment and Sunfall to wipe the board, as well as Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Beza, the Bounding Spring to provide threats, the deck aims to grind out the opponent by constantly refilling its hand with Caretaker's Talent and efficiently dealing with threats using Lay Down Arms and Get Lost. With a focus on card advantage and board control, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive spells and creatures, utilizing a mix of burn spells, card draw, and efficient creatures to apply pressure early and often. The key strategy is to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately finishing them off with a combination of burn spells and powerful creature attacks. The deck's strength lies in its ability to quickly assemble a threatening board state and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

Utilizing a mix of evasive creatures and disruptive spells, the Dimir Aggro deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while controlling the game with removal and countermagic. Floodpits Drowner and Spyglass Siren provide early aggression, supported by cards like Enduring Curiosity and Faebloom Trick for card advantage. Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares offer powerful threats, while cards like Go for the Throat and Cut Down keep the board clear. Soulstone Sanctuary and Restless Reef provide resilience, making it difficult for opponents to stabilize against the deck's relentless assault.

The main concept of this Dimir Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently control the board while being aggressive and disrupting the opponent's strategies. Cards like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner provide early game pressure, while cards like Go for the Throat and Cut Down remove threats from the opponent's side. Enduring Curiosity and Soulstone Sanctuary help maintain card advantage and resilience. The deck focuses on a balance between aggression and control, aiming to overwhelm the opponent while keeping them on the back foot.

The deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays using efficient creatures like Patchwork Beastie and Wildfire Wickerfolk. It includes powerful combat tricks like Break Out and Violent Urge to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy, with plenty of red and green sources to cast spells with ease. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain a steady stream of threats to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on putting constant pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to control the board early on with removal spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower, while also deploying threats like Emberheart Challenger and Manifold Mouse to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Innkeeper's Talent helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on, while cards like Overprotect and Self-Destruct provide protection and additional reach to finish off the opponent. The deck is designed to win the game quickly through a combination of creature damage and direct burn spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing a combination of creatures, spells, and lands to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Boilerbilges and Yuna, Hope of Spira, as well as versatile spells like Dredger's Insight and Get Lost to control the battlefield. By efficiently managing resources and applying pressure early on, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By using cards like Disdainful Stroke, Day of Judgment, and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, the deck aims to maintain control and outvalue the opponent. It also utilizes artifacts like Prophetic Prism and Meticulous Archive to generate card draw and utility. The win condition lies in establishing a solid board presence with cards like Marang River Regent and Ossification while systematically dismantling the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and applying pressure to the opponent. By utilizing cheap creatures like Marauding Mako and Voldaren Thrillseeker, as well as powerful sorceries like Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower, the goal is to deal damage efficiently and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of card draw spells like Proft's Eidetic Memory and Winternight Stories helps to maintain momentum and keep the aggression going. With a mix of creatures, spells, and a few utility cards like Spyglass Siren, this deck aims to win fast and decisively.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and removal spells. By using cards that provide early aggression like Llanowar Elves and Mosswood Dreadknight, along with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Maelstrom Pulse, the deck aims to control the board and push for a quick victory. Additionally, cards like Unholy Annex and Gix's Command provide additional value and flexibility to the deck's strategy. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace the opponent and secure a win through efficient creature beats and removal.
